spikelearn.data package¶

Submodules¶

spikelearn.data.dataWrapper module¶

Contains the base classes for dealing with data directly.

class spikelearn.data.dataWrapper.Batcher(X, y=None, axis='Last', group=None, mode='sh', train_size=0.5, test_size=0.5, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Implements an iterable cross-validator that groups all repeated indexes in the same group.

X¶

np.ndarray (n_examples, n_features) – Sklearn-style example matrix

y¶

np.ndarray (n_examples, 1) – Label of each example

axis¶

int or string – Dimension to be sliced and served in batches. Accepts ‘last’, ‘first’, and abbreviations.

group¶

np.ndarray (n_examples, 1) default: the label itself – Used to make examples always part of the same

mode¶

string – Which kind of splitting will be used for batching. Currently accepts ‘shuffle’ and ‘kfold’.

train_size¶

(int) or (float) – If int, total number of groups in the train set. If float, proportion of groups.

test_size¶

(int) or (float) – If int, total number of groups in the test set. If float, proportion of groups.

**kwargs

Extra keyword arguments will be passed to the splitting function.

Examples

>>> for X_train, X_test in Batcher(X, train_size=3, test_size=.4):
>>>     assert X_train.shape[0] == 3
>>>     assert X_test.shape[0] == 0.4 * X.shape[0]
>>> for X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test in Batcher(X, y):
>>>     assert X_train.shape[0] == y_train.shape[0]'
